key_risks: Significant regulatory scrutiny and compliance issues, including risk management deficiencies and anti-money laundering (AML) compliance
Substantial exposure to commercial real estate (CRE), increasing vulnerability to economic downturns and market volatility
Dependence on fintech partnerships and challenges related to the spin-off of BankMobile
Potential erosion of investor confidence due to allegations of misrepresenting financial health and concealing regulatory risks
controversies: Securities fraud lawsuit alleging inadequate AML practices and failure to disclose heightened regulatory risks
Failed attempts to spin off BankMobile due to regulatory complications and capital-raising issues
Criticism for misrepresenting financial health and concealing regulatory risks
social_issues: Emphasis on ESG initiatives, including sustainable lending and community development programs
governance_issues: Leadership changes and potential uncertainty during the implementation of strategic initiatives
Regulatory enforcement actions citing significant deficiencies in risk management and AML compliance

sources.title: U.S. Banks' Exposure to Risk from Commercial Real Estate Screener
sources.snippet: This data analysis examines 157 of the largest banks in the United States to calculate their exposure to commercial real estate. We calculate each bank's total commercial real estate exposure as a percentage of the bank's total equity. Any ratio over 300% is viewed as excessive exposure to commercial real estate , which puts the bank at greater risk of failure.
